title: Commander Keen 3D Beta
content:
Hello I am High School student and I am new to this board. I have been a Commander Keen fan about 12 years now.

And yesterday I started from scratch (minus some textures) to make a 3D Commander Keen games. Since there are not alot of them finished right now (is Keen Dreams 3D the only one?), I thought I would try something that hasn't been done that much.

Current project:
Right now I am working on one level that you guys can play, and if all goes well it will be done by next week. It will, hopefully, set the rules for any future 3D Commander Keen games I make.

Here are some screenshots. I am open to any *constructive* criticisim. So please do not be vague in your critiques.

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v337/Tirqin/Keen1a.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v337/Tirqin/Keen2a.jpg[/img]
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v337/Tirqin/Keen3a.jpg[/img]

I am trying to get this game to be most like the Vortican Trilogy as possible, gameplay and graphically. But of course I have to take some creative liberties, after all I am working with 3D models based on a 2d game.

I will hope that this game will be one of quality and that I would learn from this experience to help me with other game development projects I work on.

Also I would like to contribute my 3d art for people to use as a resource. If the final models are deemed acceptable by this community.

Future Projects:

After this level I would like to remake the first level of Commander Keen 1, if not the game (that would be too big for me right now). I also wouldn't mind making a completely new game.

Tools I am using:

To program the game I am using Blitz3d. For models I am using Wings3D. For animation I am using anim8or. And for levels I using Maplet, a BlitzBasic based map program (you can find it on the Blitz site).

[url=http://blitzbasic.com/]blitzbasic.com/[/url]
[url=http://wings3d.com/]wings3d.com/[/url]

Other Work:

Here are some links to other games I have made and art I have made:

[url=http://smg.photobucket.com/albums/v337/Tirqin/?sc=1&multi=1&addtype=local&media=image]smg.photobucket.com/album...edia=image[/url]
[url=http://www.christiancoders.com/cgi-bin/ubb-cgi/postdisplay.cgi?forum=Forum4&topic=000289]www.christiancoders.com/c...pic=000289[/url]
[url=http://www.christiancoders.com/cgi-bin/sc/showcase_showentry.pl?id=lava06052006153933&comments=no]www.christiancoders.com/c...omments=no[/url]
[url=http://www.christiancoders.com/cgi-bin/sc/showcase_showentry.pl?id=lava12292005213343&comments=no]www.christiancoders.com/c...omments=no[/url]
[url=http://www.christiancoders.com/cgi-bin/sc/showcase_showentry.pl?id=lava06092006141200&comments=no]www.christiancoders.com/c...omments=no[/url]

title: Re: Commander Keen 3D Beta
content:
Criticism? Okay then...

Firstly you'll want to use larger tiles then you're currently using; the tiles in the 2D game were about half Keen's height, so thats what you should aim for.

Secondly, make Keens helemt more round and sphereical; and his face not so flat and lego man like.

If its possible some sort of background would be a good idea; for example Jazz Jackrabbit 1's 3D bonus levels warp a 4 tile block to create the ilusion of mountains around the level. [This is a warp I've seen copied many times] For now though, black seems to go with everything.

I must admit, for a game only a day or two old, thats pretty damn impressive!

I look forward to seeing its completion.

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Commander Keen 3D Beta
content:
Looks good. Go for better graphics, imo.

I like the current style of blocks, actually, maybe 32x32 if you must, but no larger.


Also, make Keen much more refined --though I'm sure you will-- and that's about all I can say. Go for a Super Mario 3D style, it should work great.


It looks neat.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Commander Keen 3D Beta
content:
I'd say make the head and helmet rounder, and perhaps more seperate, along with the shoulders. The pointed blocks should be pointy, and perhaps adding a little detail to the background. Possibly add a glow to the shot as well, and making it longer, like in the origional games. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

I'm petty sure the pizza was more detailed, as were the other items. Maybe add a glow to them as well?

The game is looking quite good for something which only started yesterday... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

[hr]

---Freeyorp

title: Re: Commander Keen 3D Beta
content:
Wow, this is looking good! I like this!

I like the current way it uses the original tiles in the ground, keep that! And yeah, the models need a bit editing, but otherwise looking good already; actually only the Keen model and pizza are the ones that'd need work. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Cool yorp! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yorp.gif[/img] Can't wait to see the garg! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img]

And, welcome to the forums!3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"

title: Re: Commander Keen 3D Beta
content: make keen more human instead of a stickfigure[url=http://profile.xfire.com/memsys][img]http://miniprofile.xfire.com/bg/bg/type/2/memsys.png[/img][/url]

title: Re: Commander Keen 3D Beta
content:
Check out some good Keen fanart, and what he looks like in Keen 4/5/6. He looks really flat and 'packed together' right now.

Also, improve the tiles. You want a Keen 1-3 feel, but the old tiles just won't fit in a 3D game. Try making the tiles more realistic (but preferably still with a cartoony feel on it). Same goes for all 3D graphics and objects.

Other than that, that is REALLY some progress you made in just two days! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: Commander Keen 3D Beta
content:
Ok the model changes, I decided to make those on the polishing stage, so after the level and gameplay is done but before the animation is finished. I have edits to make on Yorp, Pizza, Keen and possibly the soda cans.

Right now I am working on the level, I made the level, but there might be some problems with the distances and jumping. After that I will have to do some lighting, the level will be lightmapped and then work on the item placement.

Then I will work on the gun's function and enemy AI. Which BTW, does anyone know how the yorps are supposed to act? They seem really random, sometimes they follow you and sometimes they go in a pattern, in Keen 1. That would be alot of help. I won't make the yorps move their eyes like they do in Keen 1, that would be kinda hard and strange to translate into 3D, but I want to at least imitate their behavior patterns.

About the tiles, I have made them bigger and they look great. But like DaVince said, it doesn't match a 3D but then like KeenRush said, it's cool to keep the original tiles. So, I made my own tiles, same design and colors as the original but cleaner and less pixelated. I *hope* that is the best of both worlds.

I think it would be interesting to see the game with really advanced textures. And I am capable of it. But that would take alot of time and right now I want to keep things simple.

@ freeyorp101

Well, in the behind position it was hard to see the laser and give a good pic at the same time. But the reason the laser is short is because the game will usually be behind Keen, so it looks short because you are behind the laser. It was short in the side pic because I just move the camera around and you could see the gun pose and laser being shot.

Hmm, a glow would be interesting. I'll see how that can be done and how it looks.

Well the pointy blocks idea sounds cool, but I cant do it in my map editor, I can made ramp shapes, but not a pyramid where everything is distributed evenly. And if I made the X and Z sides pointed, I would have to make the bottom and top pointed too, which would make it hard to climb on.

@ memsys

How so? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

But thanks guys, for all of the compliments, encouragement, and criticisim. It has been a big help and I really appreciate it [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] . I hope to make this the best Keen 3D.

title: Re: Commander Keen 3D Beta
content:
I like how you're basing it on the original Keens. There's nothing wrong with the later ones, but the original three are a little neglected in the fangame realm.________________
[img]http://img80.imageshack.us/img80/8498/missouriansf9.png[/img]

title: Re: Commander Keen 3D Beta
content:
Yes, I think you should base this on the first three more than from the latters -- not that there's anything wrong with the latters, but the first ones are more old-school. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] And yeah, it doesn't need any other kind of blocks than cubes. But that just my opinion.

About the yorp movement.. I think they move towards the x-coordinate of the player but walk past the point by a random amount of pixels. Then they do their "thinking" or whatever that movement is, and turn around, and walk towards the player x-coords. On their way they do little jumps. And if you jump on them they're stunned for a while (this would be cool feature to see in this game!).3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Commander Keen 3D Beta
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]How so? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] [hr][/quote]
Well, all I can think of is:
* Give him a neck, and adjust his shoulders so that they aren't just horizontal, stiff bars below his head. (I know it isn't easy to do)
* If possible, model his face rather than having it as a flat texture applied to the front of his head.
* Make his helmet slightly more round. (Reference pictures: [url=http://images.google.com/images?q=green+bay+packers+helmet]images.google.com/images?q=green+bay+packers+helmet[/url])

The only other change I can suggest is that you redraw the texture for the blocks - not necessarily changing how they look, just giving them a higher resolution - rather than use the original tiles from the old games. These minor criticisms aside, great job! As LevelLord said, I look forward to the completion of this game.[url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

I also starting school so I will have to muster time to finish the demo between school, but thankfully I have a good chunk that is finished.

title: Re: A little delayed....
content:
The arms being so straight next to him, his shoulders being too high and too right up, the overall "standing-like-a-candle". You could make him bow a really tiny bit, or experiment with his basic form. Also, his legs should be seperated from each other a bit more, so he really stands. Currently it looks like he's trying to be as tall as he can. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Hm, his shirt doesn't cover enough of his arms. And usually the arms are hanging a bit less stiff next to one's body.

About his face: his eyes are weird, not Keen-like. His face barely is round/oval, or at least not in a face form. His nose and mouth are positioned too high. And white might have looked good in the old-style games, but he could be a BIT more flesh-coloured in a 3D-game... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: A little delayed....
content:
A great improvement - pretty much everything I disliked about the previous screenshots has been fixed, except those arms... or more specifically, the shoulders and the hands. (The arms themselves are quite good.)

[quote]Quote:[hr]What still makes him look stiff?[hr][/quote]
This is easier to see than to describe - I think it's mainly because he's not in a natural human standing pose. For example, you can see Homer from the Simpsons: Hit and Run game in a standing pose [img]http://gallery.otakumedia.com/images/gallery/album533/Homer_At_Kwik_E_Mart.jpg[/img] - you can see that his back, arms and knees are bent slightly. This shouldn't be a problem when the Keen character is moving, though.

I think his hands could be a little smaller - even though in your screenshots he appears to be teenaged rather than a small child, his hands are still far too big. Also, how many people do you know who stand with their thumbs poking out? Or with thumbs that big in proportion to their hands, for that matter? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]
One other change I would suggest: move his mouth down. It looks a little weird so close up to his eyes - I thought it was a moustache till I looked closer [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] [url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

title: Re: A little delayed....
content:
Ah, looking great! Love the garg! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-love.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: hmm
content:
Just put more joints in things. Make sure his forearm and upper arm are distinguishable from each other, and his calf and thigh are seperate as well. Since we haven't seen Keen in any other positions besides standing yet, it's difficult to tell where those joints are.

I'd say give the Garg a joint in his eye-stalks while you're at it--that way he can do the bendy-bend that he needs to during his "searching for Keen" animation.

Other than that, you're off to a great start! Keep at it.

title: Re: A little delayed....
content:
Make his arms skinnier, it'll allow you to make them closer to his body, making him look nicer. Also make his head bigger. With the helmet on, his head should be only a little narrower than his shoulders. His nose should be rounder, like a horizontal oval, and his eyes should be bigger. The top part of the helmet should be bigger, so less of his face shows, and his whole face should be lower.-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Reply:
content:
DaVince21:

"Also, his legs should be seperated from each other a bit more, so he really stands."

Well the idea is that he is wearing jeans, kinda baggy jeans.

"Hm, his shirt doesn't cover enough of his arms. And usually the arms are hanging a bit less stiff next to one's body."

Ok, great point, I'll make his sleeves longer and move the arms closer to the body.

"His face barely is round/oval, or at least not in a face form."

Well with the helmet on it's hard to tell what his head shape looks like anyways. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

"His nose and mouth are positioned too high."

Hmm, not sure if the nose is too high, but I definately fixed the mouth.

"And white might have looked good in the old-style games, but he could be a BIT more flesh-coloured in a 3D-game... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] "

Ok, I changed his skin color.

Grafix:

"This is easier to see than to describe - I think it's mainly because he's not in a natural human standing pose. For example, you can see Homer from the Simpsons: Hit and Run game in a standing pose here - you can see that his back, arms and knees are bent slightly. This shouldn't be a problem when the Keen character is moving, though."

Ok, you made a great point and posted a great example. I have fixed this

"even though in your screenshots he appears to be teenaged rather than a small child"

Another great point, I made him a more stout.

"His hands are still far too big. Also, how many people do you know who stand with their thumbs poking out? Or with thumbs that big in proportion to their hands, for that matter? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] "

Fixed his thumbs, and I resized the hands a little bit, but it is a cartoon in a sense, so there might be some exaggeration to take into account [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

"One other change I would suggest: move his mouth down. It looks a little weird so close up to his eyes - I thought it was a moustache till I looked closer [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] "

Fixed [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]


KeenRush:
"Ah, looking great! Love the garg! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-love.gif[/img] "

Thanks man! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

XkyRauh2001:

"Just put more joints in things. Make sure his forearm and upper arm are distinguishable from each other, and his calf and thigh are seperate as well. Since we haven't seen Keen in any other positions besides standing yet, it's difficult to tell where those joints are."

Ok, I fixed that, in the bounderies of the model [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

"I'd say give the Garg a joint in his eye-stalks while you're at it--that way he can do the bendy-bend that he needs to during his "searching for Keen" animation."

Yes, I added that, I would've included it in the pics, but I just wanted to show the garg's shape. And it's a little choppy but it's the thought that counts right? Lol, I wish I had a better animating procedure :P.

"Other than that, you're off to a great start! Keep at it."

Thanks! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

Genius314:

"Make his arms skinnier, it'll allow you to make them closer to his body, making him look nicer."

Will do [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

"Also make his head bigger. With the helmet on, his head should be only a little narrower than his shoulders."

I resized his body, and so it makes his head look bigger.

"His nose should be rounder, like a horizontal oval, and his eyes should be bigger."

I made his eyes bigger, I took the eyes off of the title of Keen 4 and made them look forward. And about the nose, I might add a little more detail to the nose, but I am trying to go really simple for now.

"The top part of the helmet should be bigger, so less of his face shows, and his whole face should be lower."

Ok, good idea, this time I made the helmet only a little bit above the eyebrows.

title: Still delayed
content:
Thank you guys for all of the feedback [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

I am glad I am meeting up to the expectations of this community.

But for a little bad news....

Sadly it might be a while till Keen 3D Beta is done. Mainly because the animations. For this demo I want to have really high quality animations. But I cant do that till I get Milkshape. My friend and I entered a game making contest a while ago, and the judges are still judging, so if I win one of the categories I could win Milkshape, but if not, I won't be able to get it until (at the most), Christmas.

Of course the alternative would be to make animations manually with my modeller, and just set up a system in Blitz to show each frame every so much seconds. But that method usually doesn't produce alot of quality in the animations.

It's up to you guys, should I make manual, lower quality animations? Or should I make higher qualty animations, when I get Milkshape?

I hate having to take this long, especially since the demo isn't that big. So it would be a big disappointment.

title: Re: Keen Model Revamp #3
content:
Don't be a perfectionist for a demo. Make what you can now in reasonable time, and then go improve stuff. That way you don't have to wait with getting MilkShape, and we don't have to wait longer to play something. And if you tell people, we know that it will improve over time or a next demo. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Perfect Does Not Exist
content:
Agreed. Perfectionism is one of the contributing factors to many of the abandoned (otherwise known as 'indefinitely delayed') projects we've seen come and go over the years. Just make it work, and focus on the details later.

Is there an open source alternative to Milkshape that works with Blitz you could use for now? (Even if there is, I suggest getting some comfortable gameplay working before you focus too much on the details).

title: Don't have to use MilkShape
content: Just wanted to pop in and say you don't have to use MilkShape. [url=http://www.blender3d.org]Blender[/url] is a free, opensource modeling program you can use to make your models. I'm not sure how animation works in Blitz3D, if you have to define every frame of the animation or if it performs automatic interpolation or what, but you can probably find a way to make Blender work with it. The only bad part about Blender is that there's a pretty high learning curve, so it'll take you a while to learn how to use it, but it's a very powerful program.

title: Keen 64? I like it.
content:
Keen 64? You know, I might name it that officially.

Thanks for all of the feedback guys, I appreciate it, it's actually what keeps me going [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

And I have actually decided to make animation with bones. I know I won't get a perfect project, but it will be easier for me. Since before I made this latest rendition of Keen, I made all of the frames manually and I don't feel like making new ones again, manually, lol.

title: Re: Keen Model Revamp #3
content:
"Super Mario 64 still has really nice retro, and yet modern graphics that way you can keep it Keenish, but also keep it 3D."

The other day I was playing Mario Party and I said to my opponent, "One day people will be as nostalgic for N64 era graphics as they are for the 2d pixelated graphics before them." Then I realized that people older than me would have missed the N64 entirely, as would younger people, so it would have to be people of my generation who missed low poly 3d games. After that I had to admit that while a few years ago I would have called Mario 64 ugly and blocky, now I think it's kind of cute. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-love.gif[/img] ________________
[img]http://img80.imageshack.us/img80/8498/missouriansf9.png[/img]

title: Re: Keen 64? I like it.
content:
Well, there you go.

The 64 title would certainly be pretty sweet.

Commander Keen 64: The Marshian Pits of Peril~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Revamp 4
content:
UPDATE

Taking some advice from those on Globox's site [url=http://fortvortabella.commanderkeen.org/forum/index.php]The Barricades[/url], I made a model update.

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v337/Tirqin/KeenModel3a.jpg[/img]

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v337/Tirqin/KeenModel4a.jpg[/img]

title: Revamp #5
content:
Ok, update. Currently I am working on the shooting function on the game and it's going well. I also implemented a new jump engine into another project from a 2D game I made with a friend of mine, and it implemented well, which means it will work good on Keen, I just need to polish it when I am ready to put it in Keen. So those and adding it so you can knock out the yorps are some of the last elements to the game I need to finish, next to the graphics.

And the main event. Here is an update for the Keen model. There's also a list of what I put in the update and who suggested it.

From Barricades:

Paul Donnelly\Globox - I resized the hands

Globox - I added burn marks to the helmet and I added a wristwatch.

Genius314 - I made the head a tad bigger, I also added some padded areas like in the header so the head fits snugly.

Commander Spleen - I made the inside of the helmet a different color than the helmet exterior.

Other:

Globox (over AIM) - I added more roundness to the arms and hands and I resized the helmet just a little bit, so it didn't rest on the shoulders as much, but not too much where it looked like the 3rd model update.

Myself - I added hand and helmet interior textures

Here it is:

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v337/Tirqin/KeenModel5a.jpg[/img]

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v337/Tirqin/KeenModel6a.jpg[/img]

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v337/Tirqin/KeenModel7a.jpg[/img]

title: Re: Revamp 4
content:
Great work, it's looking really Keen now! (Even if I still like the skin white!) [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Can't wait to play this game. How is the level situation? Are the levels done yet?3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Level situation....
content: The one level in it is done, map wise. The gargs and the only yorp is setup too. Though I have to setup up some of the objects.

content:
Thanks guys!!!! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

title: Re: Keen64 Beta is OUT!
content:
I've had a look at the textures, and I think most of the lighting differences shown as a texture were actually to do with the light. perhaps in future this could be shown as in the light only?

---Freeyorp

title: Lightmap texture?
content: Ok, are you saying that I should put the coloring texture in the lightmap texture? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: Keen64 Beta is OUT!
content:
I guess what I was saying was that The shading seems to be built into the graphics, rather than a shadow from the light (as it appears in commander keen1) If you are doing a flat surface, following this logic it should be the same color! Maybe put in a slight slope in the tiles so that the light shadows the block, but keens walking is not affected..

---Freeyorp

title: The ground looks flat...
content:
I see what you mean. Though if I was to make it all the same color it would be an eyesore.

And if I was to change the ground's shape, it wouldn't fit with the original game, because in the original, even though the sides look like a pyramid, the ground keen walks on is completely flat, as if the ground is a rectangle with those designs. Because it's at a side view, so if the sides were pyramids, you could see some kind of points on the top.

Unless the sides are different than the ground keen walks on, like say the pyramid shapes on the side but the ground is flat, but I highly doubt that is the case.
